Class Game

    • controller.Game

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(Player player1,
            Player player2)
        Create a game with default setting and rules and a random starter.
        Parameters:
        player1 - Player 1
        player2 - Player 2

      • Game

        public Game(Player player1,
            Player player2,
            int xDim,
            int yDim,
            int zDim,
            int winningLength)
        Creates a game with specified dimensions of the board, winning length and random starter.
        Parameters:
        player1 - Player 1
        player2 - Player 2
        xDim - X dimension of the board
        yDim - Y dimension of the board
        zDim - Z dimension of the board, -1 specifies unlimited
        winningLength - Connected pieces required to win the game

    • Method Detail

      • randomStarter

        public int randomStarter()
        Determines a random starter of the game.
        Returns:
        the index of the starting player

      • reset

        private void reset()
        Resets the game. Same players get an empty board with a random starter.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the 4 wins game. After each ended game, the player(s) can decide whether to continue or not. The method runs until a negative response is given.

      • play

        public void play()
        Runs the game. Game starts with an empty board and finishes when there is a winner or a draw (board is full).

      • readBoolean

        public java.lang.Boolean readBoolean(java.lang.String message,
                                     java.lang.String yes,
                                     java.lang.String no)
        Determines whether the user enters Yes or No.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to print on the screen.
        yes - String that should be interpreted as "yes".
        no - String that should be interpreted as "no".
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on the input of the user.

      • currentSituation

        public void currentSituation()
        Prints the current Situation of the game.
